page.title: 06The hamlet of Conford
page.content: Conford lies hidden just off the B3004 on a slight slope. Perhaps sought after for its quiet situation, three houses were having internal alterations. An older inhabitant remarked how the real villagers were fast disappearing. The school 1873 provided by gentry, was given to the village in 1970's. By local determination and work it is the Village Hall,also catering for holiday camps from London and of conservation workers.The Old Forge, scene of a prosperous edge tool business till 1915, alterations mellowed, has newish stables on its boundary. Near the Park gates with view of small lake, also ford and footbridge, Conford House c1600 stands simply, stone walls, origigal roof,and wood framing visible one end, appreciated by its owner and lovers of our heritage.
